GUIEngine

Class turnGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUIEngine.turnGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>

    class turnGUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
    This is the EventHandler class for each StackPane that represents each cell of the GUI Grid. The handle(MouseEvent e) method in this class handles most of the logic of each turn. Later methods help in transitions and checking the end game condition.
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    adsrc, brihijoshi

    • Method Detail

      • afterTurn

        public void afterTurn(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid,
                      javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        This method is called when a recursion base case is reached, i.e., a cell suffers addition but does not explode. This function makes the changes that must happen at the end of a turn, such as serializing the GameState, checking for end game conditions, updating the active and alive statuses of the players.
        Parameters:
        grid - GridPane that represents the GUI grid
        stage - Stage of the application
        players - the list of current players

      • areValidCoord

        public boolean areValidCoord(int row,
                             int col)
        Function to decide the validity of 2-D coordinates in the GridPane. Used when checking neighbour cells for potential explosions.
        Parameters:
        row - row number of the cell
        col - column number of the cell
        Returns:
        boolean denoting the validity of the coordinates

      • checkAlivePlayers

        public void checkAlivePlayers(Player p)
        This is a utility function that evaluates how many players are active in the _players ArrayList of the GameController of the GameEngine, apart from the passed player. It iterates over the entire GridPane, and if no occurrences of a player's color is found, it sets the _isAlive property of the player to false.
        Parameters:
        p - player who is not to be evaluated to be living

      • convertGUItoGrid

        public void convertGUItoGrid(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp,
                             Grid g)
        A utility function that converts the GridPane into a serializable Grid object.
        Parameters:
        gp - GridPane that represents the GUI grid
        g - The Grid object that we replicate the GUI grid to

      • fetchCurrentPlayer

        public Player fetchCurrentPlayer()
        Fetches the current player from the _players ArrayList of the GameController of the GameEngine. Uses the currentColorHex String to find the current player.
        Returns:
        Player object of the current player

      • fetchNextPlayer

        public Player fetchNextPlayer(java.lang.String currentColor)
        This is a utility function that fetches the next player whose turn is going to come. This function fetches a Player object of the next alive player from the _players ArrayList in the GameController of the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        currentColor - The hex-code of the color of the current player
        Returns:
        Player object denoting the next player

      • get_CritMass

        public int get_CritMass(int row,
                        int col)
        An adapter which, given a row and column, gives the critical mass of the cell, on the basis of its coordinates. A corner cell has a critical mass of 2, an edge cell of 3 and an internal cell has a critical mass of 4. The critical mass is the number of adjacent cells that a cell will have.
        Parameters:
        row - row in which the cell is
        col - column in which the cell is
        Returns:
        the critical mass calculated on the basis of position

      • getCurrentColorHEX

        public java.lang.String getCurrentColorHEX()
        Returns:
        String that gives the hex-code of current color in String format

      • getGrid_put

        public Grid getGrid_put()
        Returns:
        Obtains a Grid object for serialization from the GUI grid

      • getIndexOfStackPaneFromCoords

        public int getIndexOfStackPaneFromCoords(int row,
                                         int col)
        An adapter, which, given 2-D coordinates of a StackPane, returns the 1-D coordinate it would have in the children ArrayList of its parent GridPane. Used because we did not want to maintain the index of the clicked StackPane as a separate variable. It was easy to calculate this since we had the access to number of columns in the grid from GUIMain.get_numCols(). An addition of 1 needs to be done to the answer because indexing of StackPanes in the children ArrayList of the GridPane started from 1, not 0;
        Parameters:
        row - row number of the coordinates to be converted
        col - column number of the coordinates to be converted
        Returns:
        an integer which gives the 1-D coordinate

      • getPlayers_put

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayers_put()
        Returns:
        Obtains an ArrayList of Player objects to serialize

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        This function handles each and every turn for the game, in GUI. It setsthe current color that is playing, decides whether it is valid move, and plays the move using the handleTurn method. It obtains the clicked, StackPane and manipulates it's child sphere objects.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent that triggers this function

      • handleAnimation

        public void handleAnimation(int row,
                            int col,
                            javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp)
        This method handles the explosion animation in the game. In case the cell has equalled it's critical mass, it must explode, with appropriate transitions. This is taken care of by this function. It creates four new spheres and adds them to the StackPane that is to explode. These new Sphere objects have TranslateTransition attached to them. The TranslateTransition objects are also attached to a ParallelTransition object. Once these additions are done, it plays the ParallelTransition object. The function also re-calls the handleTurn method on the valid neighbours of the clicked StackPane.
        Parameters:
        row - row number of the exploded cell
        col - column number of the exploded cell
        gp - GridPane representing the GUI grid

      • handleTurn

        public void handleTurn(int row,
                       int col,
                       javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp)
        This method handles the manipulation of spheres in the clicked StackPane. First, it obtains the 1-D index of the clicked StackPane and adds an index to it. Then, it evaluates whether the StackPane has reached its critical mass. If yes, it clears the StackPane and calls the handleAnimatio()_ function which handles the explosion animations. If no, then it simply calls the afterTurn() function.
        Parameters:
        row - row number of the clicked StackPane
        col - column number of the clicked StackPane
        gp - GridPane object that represents the GUI grid
